Refactored the render method of CPScatterPlot. The optimizations that were added recently to skip points not in the plot range did not take account of the possibility that in a scatter plot, points do not have to be ordered in X. It is possible for two out-of-range points on opposite sides of the visible range to be joined by a line. Even though the points are not visible, the line may well be. A more advanced algorithm has been added to ensure that whenever two points are in different regions, they get drawn and joined by a line.

- Coding style updates in CPPlatformSpecificCategories and CPPlotSpace

Fixed minor tick mark placement.  Minor ticks in the first positive major tick interval were being skipped.
Updated axis code so that line styling now works.
Got minor tick drawing working for CPAxis too. So axes are now working. Need to add labels.

Got the refactored axis code working (all except minor ticks). The axes are now managed by the CPGraph, and are positioned as a sublayer of the graph. The coordinate system is chosen to coincide with the plot area.
More work on adding axis support to CPGraph. Not finished yet. Still need to offset the CPAxisSet layer such that it coincides with the plot area.

Added 'reversible' property to CPAnimationTransition.

Added stubs for animation classes (inspired by Brad Larson's animations). The animation classes provide a mechanism to define transitions as subclasses of the CPAnimationTransition class. These will typically be implemented using Core Animation. (Brad's explode animation should be added here as a subclass.)

The architecture is based on key frames and transitions. You basically create a CPAnimation instance, and fill it with key frames and transitions that together define a graph of objects. The graph dictates the possible transitions, and intermediate states.
Removed CPBarGraph class. Histogram/Bar plots should just appear in an CPXYGraph. This functionality will be added in the CPBarPlot class.
Added a 3-D layer explosion to the Mac sample application main graph under the View menu for illustrative purposes.  The 3-D representation can be rotated by dragging the mouse around the graph.

Updated the iPhone static library to reflect the changes in the CPXYAxis / CPLinearAxis.  Replaced some Mac-specific encoding / decoding within CPColor with generic component writing (which may lose colorspace information, so may need to be replaced).

- Changing the font color now calls setNeedsDisplay to cause the layer to redraw.

Changed name of CPLinearAxis to CPXYAxis, because it can only be used in a horizontal or vertical orientation (ie it is not a general linear axis).

Removed some duplication in the tick drawing code.

Restructured the project a bit, moving test classes into subgroups called 'Test', to avoid too much clutter.
Added coding standards for Core Plot to the documentation directory.

Made some changes to CPAxis and CPAxisSet. Mostly clean ups of last commit (dirkjan).

One major change was to remove the axis code from CPPlotSpace. I would rather not have a plot space having any knowledge of an axes set. It should be the other way around: an axis holds a pointer to a plot space. We need a cleaner solution for updating the bounds of the axis set, probably at a higher level (eg CPGraph).
Fixed memory management issues in CPGradient and CPXYAxisSet.
Drawing performance improvements for CPPlotSymbol.
Added support for new color classes and other changes to the test apps for both Mac and iPhone.
Moved lots of platform specific code in CALayer into separate files. By only linking the files on the appropriate platform, it is not necessary to use #ifdef branches, and the code is a lot cleaner.
Added documentation directory, and a class/layer overview diagram.

More changes in the axis/axis set classes. Moved the plotSpace ivar from CPAxisSet to CPAxis. A graph will typically have one axis set, but the axes in that set could apply to different plot spaces (eg, you could have two plot spaces representing two different scales for y. You could then have two axes in the axis set, one for each scale).

Introduced CPColor and CPColorSpace classes. These are simple wrappers around CGColor and CGColorSpace.

Also refactored the CPAxisSet and CPAxis classes a little bit, introducing a CPLinearAxis subclass (note that in a pie chart, an 'axis' may be round). Main change though was to make CPAxisSet a subclass of CPLayer.

Created a new project for an iPhone Core Plot static library.  Created an iPhone sample application based on the Mac one.  Fixed various Mac-specific elements throughout the framework so that they allow the iPhone version to compile.
Added unit tests for CPPlotSymbol.

Converted existing PDF saving method in CPLayer to be NSData-based and refined its operation.  Added a method to extract a platform-specific image representation of a CPLayer.  Added export options for both to the sample application.  Changed the build settings on the framework to treat warnings as errors.
CPScatterPlotTests testRenderScatter and testRenderScatterTimeLimit now render without needing CPGraph and CPPlotArea.
Added PPC architecture reference images for unit tests.
Implemented _CPFillImage
Removed methods for replacing plots in a graph, which were buggy, and unnecessary.

Changed name of private subclasses in CPFill class cluster to include an underscore to make clear they are private.

Minor changes to unit tests. In particular, unit tests were taking too long, so reduced time taken. If unit tests take too long, nobody will do them. Performance should be addressed separately from unit tests.
Added background fill color for CPXYGraph and CPPlotArea tests to match previous defaults.
Updated CPPlotSymbol drawing so that gradient and image fills are properly centered.  Fixed triangle plot symbol geometry.

Added CPFill class cluster to handle area fills.  Areas can be filled with CGColor, CPGradient, or CGImage (images not yet implemented).  Updated CPGraph and its subclasses, CPPlotArea, and CPPlotSymbol to use CPFill.  Updated CPTestApp to set background fills for the appropriate areas.

Added a property to CPGradient to encapsulate the gradient type [axial, radial].  Changed the drawing interface to allow gradient to be drawn in a given CGRect or clipped to the current path in the CGContext.
Changed method name from renderInContext:AtPoint: to renderInContext:atPoint: for the plot symbol class.
Changed the CPXYGraph initializer in one of the unit tests to 'init' from 'initWithXScaleType:yScaleType:'.
Updated CPGradient to use CGColorRef instead of NSColor for all external color references.

Cleaned up the data source methods of CPPlot a bit. They now accept numbers, rather than decimal numbers. The user can still supply decimal numbers if they desire, for better accuracy, but they do not have to.
Changed new header files to public.

Ported CTGradient to Core Plot, and changed a few things to create CPGradient. (Original code is public domain.)

Introduced a CPFillStyle class, that will be used throughout framework in the same way as CPLineStyle.
Overrided 'init' method in CPXYGraph. It just creates a linear scaled graph.

Added CPPlotSymbol class and a sample view in CPTestApp to demonstrate the various symbol shapes.  Updated CPScatterPlot to draw the plot symbols after drawing the series line. Symbols are drawn in the same layer as the line.

Implemented the data source functionality of CPPlot and CPScatterPlot. You can now use either bindings, or a data source.

Also added various odds-and-ends, including a value transformer that can be used to convert NSNumbers to NSDecimalNumbers. This is now being used in the CPTestApp.

CPTestApp also now includes a second plot that demonstrates the data source approach.

Reduced the interface of new CPPlotRange class to make it 'minimal but complete'. Also removed a lot of commentary in the class, which wasn't really necessary, and just made understanding the class more difficult.

Removed the function 'CPMakePlotRange'. It was a quasi-initializer for the old struct, and has been superseded by a class method.

Changed the name of the default line style convenience constructor to 'lineStyle', rather than 'defaultLineStyle'. The latter implies a singleton in Cocoa.

Fixed a unit test where two decimal numbers were not equal due to machine round off.

Added Brad Larson's code to CPLayer, that allows layers to draw properly in PDFs.

Also added his CPTextLayer class, that can draw text on Mac and iPhone. The class is slightly updated from what he contributed, in that it is possible to set a font name other than the default Helvetica.
Removed some cyclic relationships which probably aren't needed. They can be put back if they are needed.

Made plot spaces sublayers of the the plot area, rather than the graph.

Add temporary drawing of backgrounds for graph and plot area, and inset the plot area by a fixed margin (for testing only).

Introduced string constants for x and y value bindings of the CPScatterPlot class.

Refactored the CPTextApp, and added a few utility methods to CorePlot. For some reason, the test app is not drawing the graph, so there is a bug there somewhere. It is also printing out error messages related to plot ranges, but it was already doing that.

Added a general CorePlot.h header.
Updated program settings in framework. The install path is now such that the framework is designed to be embedded in an app bundle, which is probably how most would use it.
